DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: MARCHESAN ALMEIDA, G.;Marchesan Almeida, Gabriel;Almeida, Gabriel Marchesan

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH:
Gabriel is currently a Senior Research Scientist at Karlsruhe Institute of Technology (KIT), in Germany. He received his BSc. Degree in Computer Science from URI, Santo Angelo, Brazil in 2004. In the same year, he started his MSc Course in Electronics and Computing Engineering at Aeronautics Institute of Technology (ITA), Sao Jose dos Campos, SP, Brazil. In 2005, he moved to Pontifical Catholic University (PUCRS), Porto Alegre, Brazil, where he finished his MSc course in Computer Science in January 2007. In the second half of 2006, he was a visiting fellow at the Space Science Centre, University of Sussex, England, UK. For the few last years, he has been working in projects in cooperation with the National Institute for Space Research (INPE), funded by the Brazilian Space Agency (AEB), both from Brazil. In 2007, he worked as researcher in embedded systems at INESC, Lisbon, Portugal. In 2008 he moved to Montpellier, France where he got, in 2011, his PhD in Microelectronics from University of Montpellier 2, LIRMM.
Research Interests: Error correcting codes, spacecraft on-board computing systems, reconfigurable devices, embedded systems, FPGAs, cryptography, and multi-processor SoC.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: bachelor's at Informática from Universidade Regional Integrada do Alto Uruguai e das Missões (2004), master's at Computer Science from Pontifícia Universidade Católica do Rio Grande do Sul (2007) and doctorate at Microelectronics from LIRMM-Université Montpellier II (2011). Has experience in Electric Engineering, acting on the following subjects: fpga, vhdl, rsa, reed-solomon and criptografia de chave pública.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Hardware/Software Co-design: Um Estudo de Caso Usando Criptografia de Chave Pública
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Algoritmos de criptografia estão evoluindo para suprir necessidades de segurança. A aritmética modular é parte integrante destes algoritmos, especialmente nos sistemas criptográficos de chave pública. Para obter melhor desempenho do sistema é desejável implementar operadores de aritmética modular em hardware. Muitos algoritmos criptográficos requerem a implementação para operandos com mais de 1024 bits. Adicionalmente, o algoritmo deve ser flexível o bastante para suportar protocolos independentes, uma característica da maioria dos sistemas de criptografia modernos. A reconfiguração dinâmica é uma questão crítica para possibilitar o balanceamento entre os algoritmos criptográficos requeridos para protocolos independentes. Outra questão importante, dada a complexidade de um sistema criptografico, é o projeto integrado hardware/software do sistema (co-design). O objetivo geral do projeto consiste em utilizar o algoritmo RSA como objeto do estudo de caso em co-design com a finalidade de comparar os resultados de um particionamendo equilibrado entre hardware e software com implementações realizadas sem a utilização dessa técnica. Neste momento está sendo realizada uma revisão do estado da arte a respeito de implementações do algoritmo RSA. Em paralelo está o algoritmo está sendo implementado utilizando-se uma linguagem de programação de alto nível (C). Em seguida, a partir dessa implementação será realizada a identificação de quais partes do algoritmo consomem mais processamento (análise de complexidade) para que se possa então implementar tais módulos em hardware. A tendência dos sistemas digitais modernos é possuir partes programáveis e configuráveis, consistindo de componentes de software e hardware (SoC). Pretende-se pois pesquisar e empregar esses sistemas utilizando-se técnicas de co-design, e eventualmente propor e desenvolver ferramenta(s) de apoio ao co-design para sistemas criptográficos

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Pontifícia Universidade Católica do Rio Grande do Sul

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES:
Funded by the Brazilian Space Agency (AEB - Agencia Espacial Brasileira) and CNPq (Programa Nacional de Microeletronica - PNM).
The research on Reconfigurable Computing for Space Applications started in 1998 at the Space Science Centre, University of Sussex, UK. From 1998 to 2002, the subject has been investigated as part of the PhD degree. The research sponsored by the Brazilian Space Agency (AEB) is an INPE need as part of the Brazilian Space Program, which is interested in the use of FPGAs for the implementation of on-board processing systems. The main objective of this research is to investigate, design and implement a CCSDS telecommand and telemetry system for a spacecraft in an FPGA. The idea behind the project is the investigation of the use of reconfigurable computing (FPGAs) to substitute the traditional approach (microprocessors) employed in the design of on-board computers.

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Consultative Committee for Space Data Systems (CCSDS)
Multi Processors System on a Chip (MPSoC)

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: PUC#SAT: CCSDS Telecommand (TC) and Telemetry (TM) Interface Targeting Reconfigurable Logic
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Traditionally, computational systems based on FPGA technology take advantage of the device's configurable resources in order to adapt to different working scenarios. This projects aims at communication system development in VHDL, targeting an anti-fuse programmable once FPGA device, that adapts to environmental conditions, with no use of reconfigurable technology. The TC/TM communication subsystem was the first module to be completed and delivered to AEB, INPE.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MARCHESAN ALMEIDA, G.;Marchesan Almeida, Gabriel;Almeida, Gabriel Marchesan

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES:
Funded by FINEP / FAPERGS (Fundacao de Amparo a Pesquisa do Estado do Rio Grande do Sul).
According to [Earl et al, 1996], Precision Farming is the title given to a method of crop management by which areas of land/crop within a field may be managed with different levels of input depending upon the yield potential of the crop in that particular area of land. The benefits of so doing are two fold: the cost of producing the crop in that area can be reduced and; the risk of environmental pollution from agrochemicals applied at levels greater than those required by the crop can be reduced. Precision farming is an integrated agricultural management system incorporating several technologies. The technological tools often include the global positioning system, geographical information system, yield monitor, variable rate technology, and remote sensing. This research is supported by FAPERGS, and the final goal is the design and implementation of prototypes of products in a joint work with Innalogics. The idea behind this FAPERGS' initiative, is to provide resources for small companies to do applied research.

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Universidade Regional Integrada do Alto Uruguai e das Missões

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Auxílio na monitoria da disciplina de Linguagem de Programação I.

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Instituto de Engenharia de Sistemas e Computadores: ID em Lisboa

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Responsible for preparing the practical laboratories for the Reconfigurable Technologies class.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The main goal of this project is to develop an adaptive homogeneous MPSoC platform. We have created a NoC-based MPSoC prototyping built of 16 Spartan3-1000 FPGAs in a mesh-based topology. The communication model is based on Message Passing Interface (MPI) in which each Processing Element (PE) runs a very tiny preemptive RTOS with run-time decision making capabilities.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MARCHESAN ALMEIDA, G.;Marchesan Almeida, Gabriel;Almeida, Gabriel Marchesan

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: ADAM: Adaptive Dynamic Architecture for MP2SoC
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: ADAM is a prospective research project that directly addresses the hot topic of MP2SoC self-adaptability to altered operating conditions, like loss of performance, appearance of faulty hardware resources, and temperature overhead. The architectures targeted by ADAM are MP2SoC, Massively Parallel MultiProcessor systems on chip (more than one hundred of processing elements) containing homogeneous functional blocks, but structurally heterogeneous.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MARCHESAN ALMEIDA, G.;Marchesan Almeida, Gabriel;Almeida, Gabriel Marchesan

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: MoKa: Montpellier and Karlsruhe Project Collaboration
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The objective of the project is to extend the capabilities of a MPSoC platform (based on FPGA) to exploit the dynamic partial reconfiguration of the system with a distributed micro-kernel.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MARCHESAN ALMEIDA, G.;Marchesan Almeida, Gabriel;Almeida, Gabriel Marchesan

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: FlexTiles - Self adaptive heterogeneous manycore based on Flexible Tiles
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: A major challenge in computing is to leverage multi-core technologies to enable the development of energy- efficient high performance systems. This is especially critical for embedded systems which have very limited energy budget as well as for supercomputers in respect to sustainability. But, efficient programming of multi-core architectures, moving towards manycores with more than a thousand cores predicted by 2020, remains an unresolved issue.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MARCHESAN ALMEIDA, G.;Marchesan Almeida, Gabriel;Almeida, Gabriel Marchesan
